Key Match Events: Quentin Grimes came off the bench to score 23 points and grab nine rebounds, drilling six of the Mavericks' 18 three-pointers.
Dallas out-rebounded the Lakers 44-33 and with 11 offensive rebounds managed 15 second-chance points to the Lakers' seven.
Anthony Davis scored 21 points and pulled down 12 rebounds for the Lakers and LeBron James added 18 points, 10 boards and eight assists.
Post-Match Reflections: Quentin Grimes told broadcaster TNT, 'We knew we had to get back on track. Came out with the right mindset after dropping five in a row, so good to get back on track.'

Lakers coach JJ Redick said his team's inability to defend the perimeter was key. 'In terms of the energy, It felt like we played a little tired tonight,' he said. 'When you're on the road and the other team is banging threes it can be a little deflating to the overall energy.'
